availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James G Gorsuch (Jefferson County, Kentucky, printer and soldier)

body.p: Jefferson County, Kentucky, printer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Abraham Gorsuch and Eleanor Gorsuch. Married to Eveline Alexander on July 13, 1852. Father of Ida Gorsuch, Eva Gorsuch, and Abe Gorsuch. Steam boat clerk in Jefferson County in 1850. Printer in Jefferson County in 1860. Served in Morehead’s Regiment (C.S.A.) from May 24, 1862, to May 24, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, District 2, p. 226A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 8 p. 585.
_Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #994041, Jefferson County Deaths, March 20, 1854, p. 21.
Kentucky, County Marriage Records, 1783-1965, Film 000819595, Jefferson County, July 13, 1852.
Henry Tanner, ed., Tanner’s Louisville Directory and Business Advertiser for 1861 (Louisville, Ky: Directory Publication and Advertising Agency, 1861), 102.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0071.
